DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Javier A. Martnez;J. A. Martnez;Martnez, J.A.;J.A. Martnez;MARTNEZ, JAVIER A.;MARTINEZ, JAVIER ALBERTO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Ph.D. in Physics (2017) - University of Havana; M.Sc. in Materials Science and Technology (2006) - University of Havana; B.Sc. in Physics (2003) - University of Havana. Assistant Researcher, University of Havana - Institute of Materials Science and Technology (IMRE). Experience in Physics and Chemistry of Surfaces at Nanoscale, Optical and Spectroscopical Properties of Matter and Virtual Instrumentation. Specific Topics: Scanning Tunneling Microscopy, Adsorption, Nanoscience, Electron Spectroscopy, Synchrotron Radiation, Light Scattering, UV-Vis & IR Spectroscopy, Particle Sizing, LabVIEW

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Scholarships from Centro Latinoamericano de Fsica (CLAF) & The Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics (ICTP) (2009-2011); and from Red de Macrouniversidades de Amrica Latina (2007-2008)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Study of the chemistry of boronic organosulfur molecules at metallic surfaces
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main objective of the project is to investigate the self-assembly properties of the two molecules. We want to compare the results with those obtained with the more simple phenyl boronic acid (PBA). PBA assembles forming trimers of molecules and undergoes a condensation process upon annealing of the sample. The molecules we propose, present additional sulfur-based functionalities, which may affect the morphological and chemical properties of the pristine organic film. We want to first check if the condensation of the molecules can be obtained and, if we will have time, we want to investigate the electronic transport properties of the condensed films, by means of Resonant Photoemission Spectroscopy.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Javier A. Martnez;J. A. Martnez;Martnez, J.A.;J.A. Martnez;MARTNEZ, JAVIER A.;MARTINEZ, JAVIER ALBERTO
